name: Hotel 373

reviews.text: This new boutique hotel is a very affordable option in the heart of midtown. The rooms are small but very comfy and the bathrooms are very nice and reasonably spacious. This hotel is a 5 minute walk to Times Square and about a 10-15 minute walk to St. Patrick's and all of the shopping along 5th ave. We travel to NYC for work every other month and stay at Hotel 373 whenever it is not booked full.
reviews.title: Affordable jewel in the heart of the city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we first looked at this hotel, my boyfirend and I were a bit apprehensive about all the reports that stated the rooms were like a box however on arrival we were pleasently surprised.
reviews.title: a brilliant find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, the hotel is in a great location. It's directly opposite the empire state building and a 10/15 minute walk takes you to Times Square.
reviews.title: Excellent, trendy, clean, budget minded hotel in great location.

reviews.text: On check-in the staff were efficient and very helpful with directions and any other queries that we had.
reviews.title: This is Not an Hotel - a building with tiny rooms

reviews.text: We were located a room on the 3rd floor. The room was quite small but was sparkling clean. There was a good size double bed and a good size bathroom. People seeking space in a room may not want to stay there but for those who only use the room as a base to sleep at night will find it perfect!
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, great customer service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Superb location. Close enough to Central Station and times square. Take the $15 bus from the airport. Day tickets for the buses and underground are only $7 50 The bedrooms are very small but the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was fine.
reviews.title: empire state building area hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in Central Station where there are lots of eating places.
reviews.title: This hotel is vastly overrated and overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: New york in March is cold so wrap up well.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel- will definitely be coming back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ratings touting this hotel are misguided and at best misleading. The lobby, room and hallways are shockingly small. It is challeging to even manuever in the King size room.
reviews.title: Good for a one night deluxe layover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On top of that, the "staff" consisted of various individuals barely in their early 20's. There is no security from the busy street and neighboring Starbucks with easy access to the elevators.
reviews.title: Fantastic little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from 4 nights at this hotel. We booked it after reading reviews on here and we weren't disappointed. The hotel is 30 seconds walk from the Empire State building, 10 minutes from Times Square and just in a great location. The rooms are small but as long as you are prepared for this you won't be disappointed. They are clean and fresh and the bed was comfortable and the shower great. There is no wardrobe but a small amount of hanging space on the wall. The hotel is above a Starbucks open until 10pm and the cafe next door can be highly recommended for pancakes!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Stayed her for 4 nights in January 2009. staff were all very friendly. room was small, but perfect for me as i was staying alone.my room may have been a bit more of a squeeze if i had been sharing.But my friends chose some other hotels and were not as lucky or happy i was! Double Bed was comfy,wall mounted tv,good shower. very clean room. lift worked witout any hassle. you could hear the city below (located 1 block from the Empire State Building,fab view of it! right infront of you!), but it never interferred on your sleep time if you needed a bit of shut-eye.You're surrounded by bars and restaurants and take-aways and shops. And of course you're right in the middle of some of the main attractions of the city. Wonderful. i'll definitely go back to 373!
reviews.title: cannot, and will not complain!

reviews.text: I stayed here with my boyfriend in april 2008 and was so impressed i returned with my best mate for a shopping trip the same time this year.Hotel prices had drastically reduced in the city due to the economic climate and i got an amazing deal of 636 USD incl all taxes and charges for a 4 night stay.I really cannot recommend this gem of a hotel highly enough, its simply got everything.
reviews.title: fantastic hotel in prime location-you couldnt ask for more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, it is spotlessly clean,modern and very well thought out. The rooms are compact - OK they do not have a wardrobe or huge space for walking around in, but hey this is NYC! The bed is REALLY comfy,the room has a desk&chair along with a flatscreen TV & ipod port (excellent idea) and free internet access.The bathroom is again compact & has a lovely power shower and marble tops. The hotel has no amenities as in bar/pool/restaurant but i GUARANTEE you dont need any of these things. There is a starbucks underneath the hotel-the smell of coffee is just gorgeous in the reception! There is an amazing deli next door called the oxford-we went there numerous times for breakfast/snacks/OJ etc....so fresh and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Excellent bargain despite of narrowness.

reviews.text: Secondly, the location couldnt be matched! 1 block from Macys and all the great shops in city/1 block from the empire state building, about 8-10 mins walk to times sq/broadway...beside loads of great bars and clubs and very easy to get a cab/subway to anywhere else you need to go. The area is busy and lively,without being loud,and is very safe.We walked home every night and didnt feel at all unsafe.
reviews.title: Perfect location, small rooms

reviews.text: I had a last minute business trip and I wanted to stay in midtown in NYC. I was looking at various "last minute" travel deals websites and a site called travelontheway.com offered me Hotel 373 for a flat $200 a night. That's a good deal. I was skeptical, but read some on-line reviews and decided to give it a try. It turned out to be a great decision. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the place was clean and well-maintained, and the room itself was very quiet, clean, nicely furnished, had a modern and upscale feel to it. Free wireless internet. Very comfortable room. Bathroom was clean and nice. My room (9th floor) had a very nice view of the Empire State Building. The room was small, but it wasn't any smaller than other NYC hotel rooms I have stayed in. There was no closet, which was a minor irritation. The hotel doesn't have amenities such as a lobby, bar, restaurant or fitness center, but everything a person could want is right out the door within a block. So, all-in-all, I think this place is a definite find.
reviews.title: Clean, Quiet, Tasteful, Bargain Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here from 29th August to 5th September and had a great time, rooms was very small but as we were out of the room all day it didn't bother us! The hotel was very clean and front desk staff so friendly and helpful. Great location close to everything and had a great breakfast cafe next door! Would definitely recommend this hotel if your travelling on a budget and want something centrally located!!
reviews.title: Great location & friendly staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is great little hotel we just happened to stumble on when searching the internet for somewhere to stay in New York.
reviews.title: Fantastic little hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfectly placed on Fifth Avenue (34th Street). Only 10 minutes walk to Times Square, Rockafella Centre, Macys and Empire State straight over the road!
reviews.title: Excellent and resonably priced!
Small, safe, and worthy of a repeat stay.
reviews.text: Yes the rooms are small, but what have you got to stay in your room for when there is Manhatten on your door step??

description: Brand new deluxe boutique hotel on world-famous Fifth Avenue. The hotel features 70 queen-bedded rooms in a sleek contemporary design. We are located at 35th and Fifth Avenue. All rooms feature free WiFi, bathrobes, I-pod docks, on-site Starbucks. Across from the Empire State Building.
